attributes.name: SEV2
attributes.description: Stability or **minor customer-impacting issues** that require immediate attention from service owners, _e.g. 1 node failed_

attributes.title: DB is at 100%
attributes.summary:
A SEV2 incident has been reported due to the Elasticsearch production database reaching 100% capacity, affecting system performance. The incident was triggered by an alert received via Slack at 3:33 PM UTC on July 25, 2025, and JP Cheung is serving as the incident commander with tasks assigned to update the incident summary and ensure role assignments. Actions taken so far include completing role assignments and updating the incident summary, while further tasks include updating the status page and sending customer communications, which currently have no assigned personnel.

- [Meeting](https://us06web.zoom.us/j/86305716812?pwd=IdyAFafaC1tjiBOJ9CNeGxl5K4vmBS.1)
- Severity: SEV2
- Services: elasticsearch-prod
- Root Cause Analysis: What caused this incident

attributes.name: SEV2
attributes.description: Stability or **minor customer-impacting issues** that require immediate attention from service owners, _e.g. 1 node failed_

attributes.resolution_message: The incident was resolved as indicated by the status being marked as "Resolved." However, the report does not provide specific details on how the database capacity issue was addressed.

attributes.title: db is at 100%
attributes.summary:
The incident report indicates that the Elasticsearch production database has reached 100% capacity, which may lead to service disruptions. This issue was reported by JP Cheung at 3:39 PM UTC on July 16, 2025, triggered by an alert from Slack. Currently, JP Cheung is handling the incident as the Commander, and has completed updating the incident summary and ensuring role assignments; however, further actions are needed, including checking the cluster health API and notifying customers. No executive sponsor or postmortem owner has been assigned.

attributes.title: Elasticsearch-prod service outage triggered by alert from web at 2:06 pm utc
attributes.summary: The incident report indicates that the Elasticsearch production database reached capacity at 100%, impacting performance. JP Cheung reported the issue and is currently managing the situation, while action items include updating the status page and communicating with customers, which remain unassigned. Alex Conrad is tasked with checking the health of the access cluster API, and there is a plan to improve unit tests in the future. The incident began with an alert on July 14, 2025, at 2:06 PM UTC.

attributes.title: db is at 100%
attributes.summary:
An incident occurred due to the `elasticsearch-prod` database reaching full capacity, which led to a significant outage affecting the Collibra website and overwhelming customer support with calls from users unable to access the site. The incident was reported by JP Cheung, who took on the role of Commander, while Andre Yang investigated the system logs and monitored health metrics. The team quickly initiated a rollback of the most recent deploy after identifying a spike in application errors, which showed improvement in error rates and response times, leading to a successful resolution. A customer update was drafted and released, notifying users of ongoing efforts to restore service. The team continued to monitor the situation to ensure stability, planning a follow-up meeting for a postmortem analysis.

- [Meeting](https://us06web.zoom.us/j/81348273232?pwd=PmyFCmncHEZc1ndbLyw8a77FRJl1Ci.1)
- Severity: SEV2
- Services: elasticsearch-prod
- Root Cause Analysis: What caused this incident

attributes.name: SEV2
attributes.description: Stability or **minor customer-impacting issues** that require immediate attention from service owners, _e.g. 1 node failed_

attributes.resolution_message: The incident was resolved by rolling back the most recent deploy, which led to improvements in error rates and response times, successfully restoring service to the Collibra website. The team continued to monitor the situation for stability and planned a follow-up meeting for a postmortem analysis.

attributes.title: DB is at 100%
attributes.summary:
The incident report indicates that the Elasticsearch production database has reached 100% capacity, causing potential service impacts. JP Cheung reported the incident, which began after an alert was triggered in Slack. Steps taken to address the issue include assigning roles and checking the health of the access cluster API, with JP Cheung as the commander overseeing the resolution process. No follow-ups have been established as of now.
